meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to render unlawful discrimination against persons on the ground of their or their associates’ disability in respect of their employment, accommodation, education, access to partnerships, membership of trade unions and clubs, access to premises, educational establishments, sporting activities and the provision of goods, services and facilities; to make provision against harassment and vilification of persons with a disability and their associates; to extend the jurisdiction of the Equal Opportunities Commission to include discrimination against persons on the ground of their or their associates’ disability, and for connected purposes.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Disability Discrimination Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: access (獲得、享用) means access as construed in accordance with section 56;
act (作為) includes a deliberate omission;

def.name: Advertisement
def.leadIn: advertisement (廣告) includes every form of advertisement, whether to the public or not, and whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a newspaper or other publication;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by television or radio;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by display of notices, signs, labels, showcards or goods;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by distribution of samples, circulars, catalogues, price lists or other material;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by exhibition of pictures, models or films; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in any other way,

def.continued: and references to the publishing of advertisements shall be construed accordingly;

def.name: Associate
def.leadIn: associate (有聯繫人士), in relation to a person, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a spouse of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another person who is living with the person on a genuine domestic basis;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a relative of the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a carer of the person; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: another person who is in a business, sporting or recreational relationship with the person;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director of Social Welfare;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any officer of the Social Welfare Department authorized in writing by the Director of Social Welfare;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any person specified in Schedule 1;

subsection.def: club (會社) means an association, incorporate or unincorporate, of not less than 30 persons associated together for social, literary, cultural, political, sporting, athletic or other lawful purposes and which provides and maintains its facilities, in whole or in part, from the funds of the association; (Amended 29 of 2008 s. 97)
Commission (平等機會委員會) has the same meaning as in the relevant Ordinance;
commission agent (佣金經紀人) means commission agent as construed in accordance with section 20;
committee (小組委員會) has the same meaning as in the relevant Ordinance;
committee of management (管理委員會), in relation to a club, means the group or body of persons (however described) that manages the affairs of that club;
conciliator (調停人) has the same meaning as in the relevant Ordinance; (Amended 15 of 2012 s. 11)
contract worker (合約工作者) means contract worker as construed in accordance with section 13;

def.name: Disability
def.leadIn: disability (殘疾), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: total or partial loss of the person’s bodily or mental functions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: total or partial loss of a part of the person’s body;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the presence in the body of organisms causing disease or illness;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the presence in the body of organisms capable of causing disease or illness;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the malfunction, malformation or disfigurement of a part of the person’s body;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a disorder or malfunction that results in the person learning differently from a person without the disorder or malfunction; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a disorder, illness or disease that affects a person’s thought processes, perception of reality, emotions or judgment or that results in disturbed behaviour,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: presently exists;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: previously existed but no longer exists;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: may exist in the future; or

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: is imputed to a person;

subsection.def: discriminator (歧視者) includes a prospective discriminator;
dynamically supported craft (藉動力而獲得支承的航行器) has the same meaning as in the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313);
education (敎育) includes any form of training or instruction;
educational establishment (敎育機構) has the same meaning as in the relevant Ordinance;

def.name: Employment

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contract of service or of apprenticeship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract personally to execute any work or labour,

def.continued: and related expressions shall be construed accordingly;

subsection.def: employment agency (職業介紹所) means a person who, for profit or not, provides services for the purpose of finding employment for workers or supplying employers with workers;
enforcement notice (執行通知) means a notice under section 73(2);
estate agent (地產代理) has the same meaning as in the Estate Agents Ordinance (Cap. 511); (Replaced 29 of 2008 s. 97)
formal investigation (正式調查) means an investigation under section 66;
genuine occupational qualification (真正的職業資格) means genuine occupational qualification as construed in accordance with section 12(3);
harass (騷擾) shall be construed in accordance with subsection (6);
intern (實習人員)—see section 22A(2); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 24)
internship (實習)—see section 22A(2); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 24)

def.name: NearRelative
def.leadIn: near relative (近親), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s spouse;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a parent of the person or of the spouse;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a child of the person or the spouse of such a child;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a brother or sister (whether of full blood or half blood) of the person or of the spouse or the spouse of such a brother or sister;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a grandparent of the person or of the spouse; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a grandchild of the person or the spouse of such a grandchild,

def.continued: and, in determining the above relationships, children born out of wedlock are to be included, an adopted child is to be regarded as a child of both the natural parents and the adoptive parent or parents and a step child as the child of both the natural parents and any step parent; (Added 29 of 2008 s. 97)

subsection.def: notice (通知、通告) means a notice in writing;
prescribed (訂明) means prescribed in rules made under section 85;
profession (專業) includes any vocation or occupation;
pupillage (見習職位)—see section 33(4); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 24)
registered (註冊) includes licensed;
relevant Ordinance (《性別歧視條例》) means the Sex Discrimination Ordinance (Cap. 480);
responsible body (負責組織) has the same meaning as in the relevant Ordinance;
trade (行業) includes any business;
training (訓練) includes any form of education or instruction;
unjustifiable hardship (不合情理的困難) means unjustifiable hardship as construed in accordance with section 4; (Amended 8 of 2020 s. 24)
volunteer (義工)—see section 22A(2). (Added 8 of 2020 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: References in this Ordinance to the dismissal of a person from employment or to the expulsion of a person from a position as partner include references—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the termination of that person’s employment or partnership by the expiration of any period (including a period expiring by reference to an event or circumstance), not being a termination immediately after which the employment or partnership is renewed on the same terms;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the termination of that person’s employment or partnership by any act of his (including the giving of notice) in circumstances such that he is entitled to terminate it without notice by reason of the conduct of the employer, or the other partners, as the case may be.

subsection.content: References in this Ordinance to the provision of facilities shall be construed to include references to making those facilities available or making arrangements for the provision of those facilities or to the provision of those facilities in buildings or premises.

For the purposes of this Ordinance, an enforcement notice or a finding by the District Court becomes final when an appeal against the notice or finding is dismissed, withdrawn or abandoned or when the time for appealing expires without an appeal having been brought; and for this purpose an appeal against an enforcement notice shall be taken to be dismissed if, notwithstanding that a requirement of the notice is quashed on appeal, a direction is given in respect of it under section 74(3).

For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person (howsoever described) harasses another person if that first-mentioned person engages in unwelcome conduct (which may include an oral or written statement) on account of that second-mentioned person’s disability, or on account of the disability of an associate of that second-mentioned person, in circumstances in which a reasonable person, having regard to all the circumstances, would have anticipated that the second-mentioned person would be offended, humiliated or intimidated by that conduct.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 6(c), references in this Ordinance to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person with a disability (or words to the like effect) shall be construed to mean a person (and whether or not he has a disability) with an associate with a disability;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person without a disability (or words to the like effect) shall be construed to mean a person without an associate with a disability.

subsection.content: For the purposes of any of the provisions of sections 22, 22A, 23, 37, 38, 38A, 39, 46 and 47, references to a person with a disability (or words to the like effect) shall be construed to include a person (and whether or not he has a disability) with an associate with a disability. (Amended 8 of 2020 ss. 24 & 40)

def.name: ExistingStatutoryProvision
def.leadIn: Subject to subsection (10), in this Ordinance existing statutory provision (現有法例條文) means any provision of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: before, on or after the enactment of this Ordinance. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 98)

subsection.content: Where an Ordinance enacted after this Ordinance was enacted re-enacts (with or without modifications) a provision of an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted, then that provision as re-enacted shall be treated for the purposes of subsection (9) as if it continued to be contained in an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Act done because of disability and for other reason

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an act is done for 2 or more reasons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one of the reasons is the disability of a person (whether or not it is the dominant or a substantial reason for doing the act),

section.continued: then, for the purposes of this Ordinance, the act is taken to be done for the reason specified in paragraph (b).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Unjustifiable hardship
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, in determining what constitutes unjustifiable hardship, all relevant circumstances of the particular case are to be taken into account including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reasonableness of any accommodation to be made available to a person with a disability;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nature of the benefit or detriment likely to accrue or be suffered by any persons concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the effect of the disability of a person concerned; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the financial circumstances of and the estimated amount of expenditure (including recurrent expenditure) required to be made by the person claiming unjustifiable hardship.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Discrimination against persons with disability, etc.
section.leadIn: A person discriminates against another person in any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the ground of that other person’s disability he treats him less favourably than he treats or would treat a person without a disability;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: he applies to that other person a requirement or condition which he applies or would apply equally to a person without a disability but—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which is such that the proportion of persons with a disability who can comply with it is considerably smaller than the proportion of persons without a disability who can comply with it;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which he cannot show to be justifiable irrespective of the disability or absence of the disability of the person to whom it is applied; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which is to that person’s detriment because he cannot comply with it; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on the ground of the disability of an associate of that other person he treats him less favourably than he treats or would treat a person without such a disability.

subsection.leadIn: A discriminator discriminates against another person (the person victimised) in any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance if he treats the person victimised less favourably than in those circumstances he treats or would treat other persons, and does so by reason that the person victimised or any other person (the third person) has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: brought proceedings against the discriminator or any other person under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: given evidence or information in connection with proceedings brought by any person against the discriminator or any other person under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise done anything under or by reference to this Ordinance in relation to the discriminator or any other person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: alleged that the discriminator or any other person has committed an act which (whether or not the allegation so states) would amount to a contravention of this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: or by reason that the discriminator knows the person victimised or the third person, as the case may be, intends to do any of those things, or suspects the person victimised or the third person, as the case may be, has done, or intends to do, any of them.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply to treatment of a person by reason of any allegation made by him if the allegation was false and not made in good faith.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Comparison of cases under section 6
section.content: A comparison of the cases of persons with or without a disability under section 6 shall be such that the relevant circumstances in the one case are the same, or not materially different, in the other.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Discrimination (palliative or therapeutic devices and auxiliary aids)
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a discriminator discriminates against another person on the ground of that other person’s disability if the discriminator treats that other person less favourably because of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that other person is accompanied by, or possesses a palliative or therapeutic device or auxiliary aid that is used by that other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any matter related to that fact, whether or not it is the discriminator’s practice to treat less favourably any person who is accompanied by, or is in possession, and is the user, of such a palliative or therapeutic device or auxiliary aid.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Discrimination (interpreters, readers and assistants)
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a discriminator discriminates against another person on the ground of that other person’s disability if the discriminator treats that other person less favourably because of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the fact that other person is accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an interpreter;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a reader;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an assistant; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a carer,

paragraph.continued: who provides interpretive, reading or other services to that other person because of the disability; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any matter related to that fact, whether or not it is the discriminator’s practice to treat less favourably any person who is accompanied by such—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an interpreter;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a reader;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an assistant; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a carer.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Discrimination and Harassment in Employment Field

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person (the employer), in relation to employment by him at an establishment in Hong Kong, to discriminate against another person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements the employer makes for the purpose of determining who should be offered that employment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the employer offers that other person that employment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to offer that other person that employment.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for the employer, in the case of a person with a disability employed by him at an establishment in Hong Kong, to discriminate against that person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the terms of employment he affords that person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by dismissing that person, or subjecting him to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Except in relation to discrimination falling within section 7, subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply to employment where the number of persons employed by the employer, added to the number employed by any associated employers of his, does not exceed 5 (disregarding any persons employed for the purposes of a private home).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) shall not apply to benefits, services or facilities of any description if the employer is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, services or facilities of that description to the public, or to a section of the public comprising the person with a disability concerned, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that provision differs in a material respect from the provision of the benefits, services or facilities by the employer to his employees without a disability; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the benefits, services or facilities relate to training.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) shall expire on the 3rd anniversary of the day on which this Ordinance is enacted.

For the purposes of subsection (3), 2 employers are to be treated as associated if one is a company of which the other (directly or indirectly) has control or if both are companies of which a third person (directly or indirectly) has control.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette— (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend subsection (3) by substituting another number for the last number appearing in that subsection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend subsection (5) by substituting another anniversary for the anniversary appearing in that subsection.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Exception where absence of disability is genuine occupational qualification

subsection.leadIn: In relation to discrimination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 11(1)(a) or (c) shall not apply to any employment where being a person without a disability is a genuine occupational qualification for the job;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 11(2)(a) shall not apply to opportunities for promotion or transfer to, or training for, such employment.

subsection.leadIn: Section 11(1)(a) and (c) and (2)(c) shall not apply to an employer who discriminates against a person with a disability, if taking into account —

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s past training, qualifications and experience relevant to the particular employment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person is already employed by the employer, the person’s performance as an employee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all other relevant factors that it is reasonable to so take into the account,

subsection.continued: the person because of the person’s disability—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: would be unable to carry out the inherent requirements of the particular employment; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: would, in order to carry out those requirements, require services or facilities that are not required by persons without a disability and the provision of which would impose an unjustifiable hardship on the employer.

subsection.leadIn: Being a person without a disability is a genuine occupational qualification for a job only where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the essential nature of the job calls for a person without a disability for reasons of physiology or, in dramatic performances or other entertainment, for reasons of authenticity, so that the essential nature of the job would be materially different if carried out by a person with a disability;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nature or location of the establishment makes it impracticable for the holder of the job to live elsewhere than in premises provided by the employer, and the only such premises which are available for persons holding that kind of job are lived in, or normally lived in, by persons without a disability and, subject to subsection (5), are not equipped with accommodation and facilities for persons with a disability where the alteration of those premises to be so equipped would impose an unjustifiable hardship on the employer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the job needs to be held by a person without a disability because of restrictions imposed by a provision specified in Schedule 3.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) applies where some only of the duties of the job fall within any paragraph of that subsection as well as where all of them do.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (b) of subsection (3) shall not apply in relation to the filling of a vacancy where the applicant for that vacancy, being a person with a disability, proposes to the employer that, on appointment to the vacancy, he will make reasonable alterations to that part of the premises to be occupied by him as accommodation if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant undertakes to restore the premises to their condition before alteration on leaving the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in all the circumstances it is likely that the applicant will perform the undertaking;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in all the circumstances, the action required to restore the premises to their condition before alteration is reasonably practicable;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the alteration is at that applicant’s expense; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the alteration does not involve alteration of other premises occupied by any other person.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of subsection (3) shall not apply in relation to the filling of a vacancy at a time when the employer already has employees without a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who are capable of carrying out the duties falling within that paragraph;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whom it would be reasonable to employ on those duties; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whose numbers are sufficient to meet the employer’s likely requirements in respect of those duties without undue inconvenience.

subsection.content: This section applies to any work for a person (the principal) which is available for doing by individuals (contract workers) who are employed not by the principal himself but by a contractor or sub-contractor of the principal. (Amended 29 of 2008 s. 98)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), it is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which this section applies, to discriminate against a contract worker with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which he allows the contract worker to do that work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by not allowing the contract worker to do it or continue to do it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way he affords the contract worker access to any benefits, services or facilities or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford the contract worker access to them; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting the contract worker to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b) shall not apply to a principal who does any act in relation to a contract worker with a disability at a time when if the work were to be done by a person taken into his employment being a contract worker without a disability would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(b) shall not apply to a principal who discriminates against a contract worker with a disability, if taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contract worker’s past training, qualifications and experience relevant to working as a contract worker;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person is already working for the principal as a contract worker, the contract worker’s performance as a contract worker; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all other relevant factors that it is reasonable to so take into the account,

subsection.continued: the contract worker because of the contract worker’s disability—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: would be unable to carry out the inherent requirements of a contract worker; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: would, in order to carry out those requirements, require services or facilities that are not required by persons without a disability and the provision of which would impose an unjustifiable hardship on the principal.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(c) shall not apply to benefits, services or facilities of any description if the principal is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, services or facilities of that description to the public, or to a section of the public to which the contract worker with a disability belongs, unless that provision differs in a material respect from the provision of the benefits, services or facilities by the principal to his contract workers without a disability.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: contractor (承判商) means a person who undertakes any work for the principal under a contract that is entered into by the person directly with the principal;

sub-contractor (次承判商) means a person who enters into a contract with another person (whether or not a contractor of the principal) to undertake all or any part of the work that a contractor of the principal has undertaken. (Added 29 of 2008 s. 98)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Meaning of employment at establishment in Hong Kong

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance (the relevant purposes), employment is to be regarded as being at an establishment in Hong Kong unless the employee does his work wholly or mainly outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employment on board a ship registered in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: employment on aircraft or dynamically supported craft registered in Hong Kong and operated by a person who has his principal place of business, or is ordinarily resident, in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: but for the relevant purposes such employment is to be regarded as being at an establishment in Hong Kong unless the employee does his work wholly outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: In the case of employment on board a ship registered in Hong Kong (except where the employee does his work wholly outside Hong Kong) the ship shall for the relevant purposes be deemed to be the establishment.

Where work is not done at an establishment it shall be treated for the relevant purposes as done at the establishment from which it is done or (where it is not done from any establishment) at the establishment with which it has the closest connection.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a firm consisting of not less than 6 partners, in relation to a position as partner in the firm, to discriminate against a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements the firm makes for the purpose of determining who should be offered that position;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the firm offers him that position;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to offer him that position; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in a case where he already holds that position—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the way the firm affords him access to any benefits, services or facilities, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford him access to them; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by expelling him from that position or subjecting him to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall apply in relation to persons proposing to form themselves into a partnership as it applies in relation to a firm.
Subsection (1)(a) and (c) shall not apply to a position as partner where, if it were employment, being a person without a disability would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(a), (c) and (d)(ii) shall not apply to a person who discriminates against another person with a disability, if taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that other person’s past training, qualifications and experience relevant to the proposed firm or firm, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where that other person is already a partner, that other person’s performance as a partner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all other relevant factors that it is reasonable to so take into account,

subsection.continued: that other person because of that other person’s disability—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: would be unable to carry out the inherent requirements of a partner in the proposed firm or firm, as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: would, in order to carry out those inherent requirements, require services or facilities that are not required by partners without a disability and the provision of which would impose an unjustifiable hardship on the proposed firm or firm, as the case may be.

subsection.content: In the case of a limited partnership references in subsection (1) to a partner shall be construed as references to a general partner within the meaning of section 2 of the Limited Partnerships Ordinance (Cap. 37).

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend subsection (1) by— (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: substituting another number for the number appearing in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: repealing the words and number appearing after “for a firm” and before “, in relation to”.

subsection.content: This section applies to an organization of workers, an organization of employers, or any other organization whose members carry on a particular profession or trade for the purposes of which the organization exists.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an organization to which this section applies, in the case of a person with a disability who is not a member of the organization, to discriminate against him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which it is prepared to admit him to membership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to accept his application for membership.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an organization to which this section applies, in the case of a person with a disability who is a member of the organization, to discriminate against him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the way it affords him access to any benefits, services or facilities, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford him access to them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by depriving him of membership, or varying the terms on which he is a member; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by subjecting him to any other detriment.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an authority or body which can confer an authorization or qualification which is needed for, or facilitates, engagement in a particular profession or trade to discriminate against a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which it is prepared to confer on him that authorization or qualification;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to grant his application for it; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by withdrawing it from him or varying the terms on which he holds it.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authority or body is required by law to satisfy itself as to his good character before conferring on a person an authorization or qualification which is needed for, or facilitates, his engagement in any profession or trade then, without prejudice to any other duty to which it is subject, that requirement shall be taken to impose on the authority or body a duty to have regard to any evidence tending to show that he, or any of his employees or agents (whether past or present), has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: practised unlawful discrimination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: engaged in unlawful harassment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: engaged in acts which contravene section 46 or 47,

subsection.continued: in, or in connection with, the carrying on of any profession or trade.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to an authority or body which discriminates against a person on the ground of the person’s disability, if taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person’s past training, qualifications and experience relevant to the particular profession, trade or occupation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where that person is already a member of the profession, carrying on the trade or engaged in the occupation, that person’s performance in the profession, trade or occupation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all other relevant factors that it is reasonable to so take into the account,

subsection.continued: that person because of that person’s disability, would be unable to carry out the inherent requirements of the profession, trade or occupation.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply to discrimination which is rendered unlawful by section 24.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorization or qualification (授權或資格) includes recognition, licensing, registration, enrolment, approval and certification;
confer (授予) includes renew or extend.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Persons concerned with provision of vocational training

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful, in the case of a person with a disability seeking or undergoing training which would help fit him for any employment, for any person (the trainer) who provides facilities for such training to discriminate against him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the trainer affords him access to any training course or other facilities concerned with such training;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford him such access;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by terminating his training; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting him to any other detriment during the course of his training.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: discrimination which is rendered unlawful by any of the provisions of section 11(1) or (2) or 24; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: discrimination which would be rendered unlawful by any of those provisions but for the operation of any other provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an employment agency to discriminate against a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the agency offers to provide any of its services;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to provide any of its services; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way it provides any of its services.

subsection.content: References in subsection (1) to the services of an employment agency include guidance on careers and any other services related to employment.
Subsection (1) shall not apply if the discrimination only concerns employment which the employer could lawfully refuse to offer the person with a disability concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to an employment agency which discriminates against a person with a disability, if taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person’s past training, qualifications and experience relevant to the work sought; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all other relevant factors that it is reasonable to take into account,

subsection.continued: that person because of that person’s disability, would be unable to carry out the inherent requirements of the employment sought.

subsection.leadIn: An employment agency shall not be subject to any liability under this section if it proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that it acted in reliance on a statement made to it by the employer to the effect that, by reason of the operation of subsection (3), its action would not be unlawful; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it was reasonable for it to rely on the statement.

subsection.content: A person who knowingly or recklessly makes a statement of the kind referred to in subsection (5)(a) which in a material respect is false or misleading commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

This section applies to any work for a person (the principal) which is available for doing by individuals (commission agents) as the agents of the principal and who are remunerated, whether in whole or in part, by commission.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which this section applies, to discriminate against a person with a disability who is a commission agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which he allows the person with a disability to do that work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by not allowing that person to do it or continue to do it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way he affords that person access to any benefits, services or facilities or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford that person access to them; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting that person to any other detriment.

subsection.content: The principal does not contravene subsection (2)(b) by doing any act in relation to a person with a disability at a time when if the work were to be done by a person taken into his employment being a person without a disability would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(b) shall not apply to a principal who discriminates against a commission agent with a disability, if taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the commission agent’s past training, qualifications and experience relevant to working as a commission agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person is already working for the principal as a commission agent, the commission agent’s performance as a commission agent; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all other relevant factors that it is reasonable to so take into the account,

subsection.continued: the commission agent because of the commission agent’s disability—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: would be unable to carry out the inherent requirements of a commission agent; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: would, in order to carry out those requirements, require services or facilities that are not required by persons without a disability and the provision of which would impose an unjustifiable hardship on the principal.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(c) shall not apply to benefits, services or facilities of any description if the principal is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, services or facilities of that description to the public, or to a section of the public to which the person with a disability belongs, unless that provision differs in a material respect from the provision of the benefits, services or facilities by the principal to his commission agents.

Subject to subsection (2), without prejudice to the operation of the other provisions of this Part in relation to the Government, it is unlawful for the Government to discriminate against a person with a disability in the performance of its functions or the exercise of its powers.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not render unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as regards a person with a disability not having the right to enter and remain in Hong Kong, any act done under any immigration legislation governing entry into, stay in and departure from Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any act done in relation to a person with a disability if it was necessary for that act to be done in order to comply with a requirement of an existing statutory provision.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person, in relation to employment by him at an establishment in Hong Kong, to harass a person with a disability who is seeking to be employed by the first-mentioned person.
It is unlawful for a person, in the case of a person with a disability employed by him at an establishment in Hong Kong, to harass that second-mentioned person.

It is unlawful for a person who is employed by another person at an establishment in Hong Kong to harass a third person with a disability who is seeking to be, or who is, employed by that second-mentioned person.
It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which section 13 applies, to harass a person with a disability who is a contract worker.
It is unlawful for a contract worker to harass a person with a disability who is a fellow contract worker.
It is unlawful for a partner in a firm to harass a person with a disability who is seeking to be, or who is, a partner in the firm.
Subsection (6) shall apply in relation to persons proposing to form themselves into a partnership as it applies in relation to a firm.
Section 15(5) shall apply to subsection (6) as it applies to section 15(1).
It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which section 20 applies, to harass a person with a disability who is a commission agent.
It is unlawful for a commission agent to harass a person with a disability who is a fellow commission agent.
It is unlawful for a person who is seeking to be, or who is, employed by a person with a disability at an establishment in Hong Kong to harass that person.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person residing in any premises to harass a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employed by another person at an establishment in Hong Kong (and whether or not that other person also resides in those premises or those premises are that establishment); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carrying out in those premises all or part of that person’s work in relation to that person’s employment (and whether or not that person also resides in those premises).

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person who is a workplace participant to harass a person with a disability who is also a workplace participant at a workplace of them both.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period of work the completion of which is required for attaining a professional or academic qualification and includes a pupillage; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other work that is usually described as an internship;

subsection.def: volunteer (義工) means a person who performs volunteer work other than in the capacity of an employer or employee;

def.name: Workplace
def.leadIn: workplace (工作場所), in relation to a person, means a place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at which the person works as a workplace participant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person attends as a workplace participant;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a contract worker;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the principal, within the meaning of section 13(1), of a contract worker;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a commission agent;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the principal, within the meaning of section 20(1), of a commission agent;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a partner in a firm;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an intern; or
a volunteer.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a member of an organization to which section 16 applies to harass a person with a disability who is seeking to be, or who is, a member of the organization.

It is unlawful for a member of an authority or body referred to in section 17 to harass a person with a disability seeking an authorization or qualification (within the meaning of that section) which can be conferred by the authority or body, as the case may be.

It is unlawful for a person to harass a person with a disability seeking or undergoing training which would help fit the second-mentioned person for any employment if that first-mentioned person provides facilities for such training.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: operates an employment agency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a member of the staff of an employment agency,

subsection.continued: to harass a person with a disability in the course of offering to provide, or providing, any of the agency’s services to him.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Discrimination and Harassment in other Fields

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), it is unlawful for an educational establishment to discriminate against a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by refusing or failing to accept that person’s application for admission as a student; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions on which it is prepared to admit that person as a student.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), it is unlawful for an educational establishment to discriminate against a student with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: by expelling that student; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by subjecting that student to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply to an educational establishment which discriminates against a person with a disability in respect of admission to an educational establishment established wholly or primarily for students who have a particular disability where that person does not have that particular disability.

Subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply to an educational establishment which refuses or fails to accept a person’s application for admission as a student at an educational establishment where that person, if admitted as a student by the educational establishment, would require services or facilities that are not required by students who do not have a disability and the provision of which would impose unjustifiable hardship on the educational establishment.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply to an educational establishment which discriminates against a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if that person is not reasonably capable of performing the actions or activities reasonably required by the educational establishment in relation to students at that educational establishment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the students who participate in or are to participate in those actions or activities are selected by a method which is reasonable on the basis of their skills and abilities relevant to those actions or activities and relative to each other.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), it is unlawful for a person to discriminate against another person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: in relation to the provision of means of access to such premises;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions on which the first-mentioned person is prepared to allow that other person the use of any such facilities; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: by requiring the other person to leave such premises or cease to use such facilities.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to a person who discriminates against another person with a disability in relation to the provision of access to premises if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the premises are so designed or constructed as to be inaccessible to a person with a disability; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any alteration to the premises to provide such access would impose unjustifiable hardship on the first-mentioned person who would have to provide that access.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), it is unlawful for a person who, whether for payment or not, provides goods, services or facilities, to discriminate against another person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by refusing to provide that other person with those goods, services or facilities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions on which the first-mentioned person provides that other person with those goods, services or facilities; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the manner in which the first-mentioned person provides that other person with those goods, services or facilities.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to a person who discriminates against another person with a disability if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provision of the goods, services or facilities would impose unjustifiable hardship on the person who would have to provide those goods, services or facilities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the facilities described in paragraphs (c), (d), (e) or (f) of section 27 (or facilities of a like nature to the facilities so described) and to the extent that those facilities are physical in nature, those facilities are so designed or constructed as to be inaccessible to a person with a disability.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Examples of services and facilities
section.leadIn: The following are examples of the services and facilities referred to in section 26—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: access to and use of any place which members of the public or a section of the public are permitted to enter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accommodation in a hotel, guesthouse or other similar establishment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: facilities by way of banking or insurance or for grants, loans, credit or finance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: facilities for education, including the conduct of public examinations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: facilities for entertainment, recreation or refreshment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: facilities for transport or travel;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the services relating to transport or travel;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the services relating to telecommunications;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the services of any profession or trade;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any department of the Government; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any undertaking by or of the Government.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Discrimination in disposal or management of premises

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person (the disposer), in relation to premises in Hong Kong of which he has power to dispose, to discriminate against another person with a disability or any other person providing, or intending to provide, services or facilities on those premises (and who for this purpose is to be treated as an associate of that other person with a disability) to persons with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the disposer offers him those premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing his application for those premises; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in his treatment of him in relation to any list of persons in need of premises of that description.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person (the manager), in relation to premises managed by him, to discriminate against another person with a disability occupying the premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the way the manager affords him access to any benefits or facilities, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford him access to them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by evicting him, or subjecting him to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply to a person who owns an estate or interest in the premises and wholly occupies them unless he uses the services of an estate agent for the purposes of the disposal of the premises, or publishes or causes to be published an advertisement in connection with the disposal.

Subsection (2) shall not apply to a person who discriminates against another person with a disability if the affording of access to any benefits or facilities would impose unjustifiable hardship on the person affording such access.

subsection.def: In this section in relation to premises, power to dispose (有權處置) includes the power to sell, rent, let, sub-let or otherwise part with possession of those premises.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Discrimination: consent for assignment or sub-letting

subsection.content: Where the licence or consent of the landlord or of any other person (the disposer) is required for the disposal to any person of premises in Hong Kong comprised in a tenancy, it is unlawful for the disposer to discriminate against another person with a disability by withholding the licence or consent for disposal of the premises to that other person.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for the disposer to discriminate against another person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by evicting that other person from the premises occupied by that other person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by subjecting that other person to any other detriment in relation to the premises occupied by that other person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: by refusing to permit that other person to make reasonable alterations to the premises occupied by that person if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that other person has undertaken to restore the premises to their condition before alteration on leaving the premises;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in all the circumstances it is likely that that other person will perform the undertaking;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in all the circumstances, the action required to restore the premises to their condition before alteration is reasonably practicable;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the alteration is at that other person’s own expense; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the alteration does not involve alteration of other premises occupied by any other person.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the disposer, or a near relative of his (the relevant occupier) resides, and intends to continue to reside, on the premises;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there is on the premises, in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier, accommodation (not being storage accommodation or means of access) shared by the relevant occupier with other persons residing on the premises who are not members of his household; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the premises are small premises as construed in accordance with section 30(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a disposer who discriminates against another person with a disability if the granting of the licence or consent for disposal of the premises by the disposer would impose unjustifiable hardship on the disposer.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that this section applies to tenancies created before the enactment of this Ordinance as well as to tenancies created on or after the enactment of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: disposal (處置), in relation to premises comprised in a tenancy, includes assignment of the tenancy and sub-letting or parting with possession of the premises or any part of the premises;

def.name: Tenancy
def.leadIn: tenancy (租賃) means a tenancy created—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a lease or sub-lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by an agreement for a lease or sub-lease;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a tenancy agreement; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: pursuant to any enactment.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 26(1) and 28 shall not apply to the provision by a person of accommodation in any premises, or the disposal of premises by him, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person or a near relative of his (the relevant occupier) resides, and intends to continue to reside, on the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is on the premises, in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier, accommodation (not being storage accommodation or means of access) shared by the relevant occupier with other persons residing on the premises who are not members of his household; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the premises are small premises.

subsection.leadIn: Premises shall be treated for the purposes of subsection (1) as small premises if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of premises comprising residential accommodation for one or more households (under separate letting or similar agreements) in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier, there is not normally residential accommodation for more than 2 such households and only the relevant occupier and any members of his household reside in the accommodation occupied by him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of premises not falling within paragraph (a), there is not normally residential accommodation on the premises for more than 6 persons in addition to the relevant occupier and any members of his household.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend subsection (2)(b) by substituting another number for the number appearing in that subsection. (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)
Subject to subsection (5), this section applies to a body the activities of which are carried on otherwise than for profit.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 26(1), 28 and 29 shall not be construed as rendering unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the restriction of membership of any body to which this section applies to persons without a disability (disregarding any minor exceptions) where such restriction is reasonable having regard to the main object of the body; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provision of benefits, services or facilities to members of any body to which this section applies where the membership is so restricted,

subsection.continued: even though membership of the body is open to the public, or to a section of the public.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in section 26, 28 or 29 shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be construed as affecting a provision to which this subsection applies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: render unlawful an act which is done in order to give effect to such a provision.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) applies to a provision for conferring benefits on persons without a disability (disregarding any benefits to persons with a disability which are exceptional or are relatively insignificant), being a provision which constitutes the main object of a body to which this section applies.
This section shall not apply to a body whose recurrent expenditure is funded wholly or in part by the Government.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to discrimination which is rendered unlawful by any provision or Part of this Ordinance specified in column 1 of Schedule 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to discrimination which would be so unlawful but for any provision or Part of this Ordinance specified in column 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Discrimination by, or in relation to, barristers

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to any offer of a pupillage or tenancy, to discriminate against a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements which are made for the purpose of determining to whom it should be offered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of any terms on which it is offered; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to offer it to him.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to a person with a disability who is a pupil or tenant in the chambers concerned, to discriminate against him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of any terms applicable to him as a pupil or tenant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the opportunities for training, or gaining experience, which are afforded or denied to him;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the benefits, services or facilities which are afforded or denied to him; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by terminating his pupillage or by subjecting him to any pressure to leave the chambers or other detriment.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for any person, in relation to the giving, withholding or acceptance of instructions to a barrister, to discriminate against a person with a disability.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: barrister’s clerk (大律師書記) includes any person carrying out any of the functions of a barrister’s clerk;
pupil (見習大律師), pupillage (見習職位), tenancy (租賃) and tenant (承租人) have the meanings commonly associated with their use in the context of a set of barristers’ chambers.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), it is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to discriminate against a person with a disability who is not a member of the club—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by refusing or failing to accept that person’s application for membership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions on which the club is prepared to admit that person to membership.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), it is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to discriminate against a person with a disability who is a member of the club—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions of membership that are afforded to that member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or failing to accept that member’s application for a particular class or type of membership;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by denying that member’s access, or limiting that member’s access, to any benefit, service or facility provided by the club;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by depriving that member of membership or varying the terms of membership; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by subjecting that member to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(c) shall not apply to a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club which discriminates against a person with a disability where, because of that person’s disability, that person requires the benefit, service or facility to be provided in a special manner and the benefit, service or facility cannot without unjustifiable hardship be so provided by the club.

Subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply to a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club which discriminates against a person with a disability if membership (however described) of the club is restricted only to persons who have a particular disability and that first-mentioned person does not have that disability.
Subject to subsection (3), it is unlawful for a person to discriminate against another person with a disability by excluding that other person from a sporting activity.
In subsection (1), a reference to a sporting activity includes a reference to an administrative or coaching activity in relation to any sport.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to a person who discriminates against another person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if that other person is not reasonably capable of performing the actions reasonably required in relation to the sporting activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the persons who participate or are to participate in the sporting activities are selected by a method which is reasonable on the basis of their skills and abilities relevant to the sporting activity and relative to each other; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if a sporting activity is conducted only for persons who have a particular disability and that other person does not have that disability.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), without prejudice to the operation of the other provisions of this Part in relation to the Government, it is unlawful for the Government to discriminate against a person with a disability in the performance of its functions or the exercise of its powers.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not render unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as regards a person with a disability not having the right to enter and remain in Hong Kong, any act done under any immigration legislation governing entry into, stay in and departure from Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any act done in relation to a person with a disability if it was necessary for that act to be done in order to comply with a requirement of an existing statutory provision.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a student of an educational establishment, or a person who is, or is a member of, the responsible body for an educational establishment, as the case may be, to harass a person with a disability who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of that educational establishment.

It is unlawful for a person who is a member of the staff of an educational establishment to harass a person with a disability who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of that educational establishment.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of an educational establishment to harass a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is, or is a member of, the responsible body for; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is a member of the staff of,

subsection.continued: the establishment.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Harassment in relation to the provision of goods, services and facilities

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who, whether for payment or not, provides goods, services or facilities, to harass another person with a disability who— (Amended 8 of 2020 s. 35)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wants to acquire the goods or services;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in the course of acquiring the goods or services;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: wants to make use of the facilities; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is in the course of making use of the facilities. (Amended 8 of 2020 s. 35)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wants to acquire goods or services;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in the course of acquiring goods or services;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: wants to make use of facilities; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is in the course of making use of facilities,

subsection.continued: to harass another person with a disability who, whether for payment or not, provides the goods, services or facilities. (Added 8 of 2020 s. 35)

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: interfere with the provision of goods, services or facilities to another person with a disability; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevent or to attempt to prevent another person who, whether for payment or not, provides goods, services or facilities, or wishes to provide goods, services or facilities from providing those goods, services or facilities to a third person with a disability.

section.name: s38A
section.heading: Harassment by clubs
section.content: It is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to harass a person with a disability who is, or has applied to be, a member of the club.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises managed by him, to harass a person with a disability occupying the premises.

Where the licence or consent of the landlord or of any other person is required for the disposal to any person of premises in Hong Kong comprised in a tenancy, it is unlawful for the landlord or other person to harass a person with a disability seeking the licence or consent for disposal of the premises to him.
Section 29(5) shall apply to subsection (2) as it applies to section 29.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to any chambers, to harass a person with a disability—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the course of offering to provide to him pupillage or tenancy in the chambers; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is a pupil or tenant in the chambers.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for any person, in the course of the giving, withholding or acceptance of instructions to a barrister, to harass a person with a disability who is a barrister.
Section 33(4) shall apply to subsections (4) and (5) as it applies to section 33.

subsection.leadIn: Section 26(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not apply to goods, services or facilities outside Hong Kong except as provided in subsections (2) and (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not apply to facilities by way of banking or insurance or for grants, loans, credit or finance, where the facilities are for a purpose to be carried out, or in connection with risks wholly or mainly arising, outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: Section 26(1) applies to the provision of facilities for travel outside Hong Kong where the refusal or omission occurs in Hong Kong or on a ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: Section 26(1) applies on and in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any ship registered in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft belonging to or possessed by the Government,

subsection.continued: even if the ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft is outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: This section shall not render unlawful an act done in or over a place outside Hong Kong, or in or over that place’s territorial waters, if any, for the purpose of complying with the laws of that place.

subsection.leadIn: Section 24 shall not apply to benefits, services or facilities outside Hong Kong except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: travel on a ship registered in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: benefits, services or facilities provided on a ship so registered.

subsection.content: Section 38(1) and (1A) does not apply to an act of harassment that is committed outside Hong Kong except as provided in subsection (7). (Added 8 of 2020 s. 37)

Section 38(1) and (1A) applies to an act of harassment that is committed on a ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft referred to in subsection (3)(a), (b) or (c) even if it is outside Hong Kong when the act is committed. (Added 8 of 2020 s. 37)

subsection.def: In this section discriminatory practice (歧視性的做法) means the application of a requirement or condition which results in an act of discrimination which is unlawful by virtue of any provision of Part 3 or 4 as read with section 6(b) or which would be likely to result in such an act of discrimination if the persons to whom it is applied were not all persons with a disability.

subsection.leadIn: A person acts in contravention of this section if and so long as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he applies a discriminatory practice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he operates practices or other arrangements which in any circumstances would call for the application by him of a discriminatory practice.

subsection.content: Proceedings in respect of a contravention of this section shall be brought only by the Commission in accordance with the provisions of sections 73, 74, 75, 76 and 77.

If, because of another provision of Part 3 or 4, it would be unlawful, in particular circumstances, for a person to discriminate against another person, in doing a particular act, it is unlawful for the first-mentioned person to request or require that other person to provide, in connection with or for the purposes of the doing of the act, information (whether by completing a form or otherwise) that persons who do not have a disability would not, in circumstances that are the same or are not materially different, be requested or required to provide.

Subject to subsection (3), if, because of section 11(1), it would be unlawful, in particular circumstances, for a person to discriminate against another person, in doing a particular act, it is unlawful for the first-mentioned person to request or require that other person to provide information of a medical nature (whether by completing a form or otherwise) in connection with or for the purposes of the doing of the act.

Nothing in subsection (2) shall render it unlawful for a person to request or require another person to provide information of a medical nature that is necessary to determine if that other person would be unable to carry out the inherent requirements of the job or would require services or facilities that are not required by persons without a disability.

It is unlawful to publish or cause to be published an advertisement which indicates, or might reasonably be understood as indicating, an intention by a person to do any act which is or might be unlawful by virtue of Part 3 or 4.
Subsection (1) shall not apply to an advertisement if the intended act would not in fact be unlawful.

subsection.leadIn: The publisher of an advertisement made unlawful by subsection (1) shall not be subject to any liability under that subsection in respect of the publication of the advertisement if he proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the advertisement was published in reliance on a statement made to him by the person who caused it to be published to the effect that, by reason of the operation of subsection (2), the publication would not be unlawful; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it was reasonable for him to rely on the statement.

subsection.content: A person who knowingly or recklessly makes a statement of the kind referred to in subsection (3) which in a material respect is false or misleading commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Instructions to discriminate
section.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who has authority over another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with whose wishes that other person is accustomed to act,

section.continued: to instruct him to do any act which is unlawful by virtue of Part 3 or 4, or procure or attempt to procure the doing by him of any such act.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful to induce, or attempt to induce, a person to do any act which contravenes Part 3 or 4 by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing or offering to provide him with any benefit, service or facility; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subjecting or threatening to subject him to any detriment.

subsection.content: An offer or threat is not prevented from falling within subsection (1) because it is not made directly to the person concerned, if it is made in such a way that he is likely to hear of it.

It is unlawful for a person, by any activity in public, to incite hatred towards, serious contempt for, or severe ridicule of, another person with a disability or members of a class of persons with a disability.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), it is immaterial whether a person is actually incited, by an activity, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hatred towards;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serious contempt for; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: severe ridicule of,
